New Records: New Zealand's total of 215/3 is their second highest score at Sky Stadium in Wellington.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh scored an unbeaten 72 runs and took one wicket.
Tim David remained unbeaten with 31 runs, leading Australia to victory.
Devon Conway and Finn Allen provided a stellar start for New Zealand, with Allen scoring 36.
Conway and Rachin Ravindra had a partnership of over 100 runs.
Mark Chapman and Glenn Phillips helped New Zealand surpass the 200 run mark.
Mitchell Santner picked two wickets for New Zealand.
Adam Milne and Lockie Ferguson took one wicket each for New Zealand.
Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins picked one wicket each for Australia.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Santner won the toss and decided to bat first.
This match is part of a 3-T20 series, the last for both teams before the T20 World Cup.
Australia recently defeated the West Indies 2-1 in a T20 series.
This is David Warner's last bilateral T20 series.
New Zealand won their last T20I series against Pakistan with a 4-1 margin.
The Sky Stadium pitch is expected to favor batsmen, leading to a high-scoring match.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket.
